instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no battery charge
threads.message:
Hello I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that can turn on from the battery but is not taking a charge (shows charging in right top corner but not in hardware overview). Measured following:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>   =   12.6
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>   =   3.47
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>   =   Switching on/off when on AC Charger

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
ACIN Pin 3 =  3.98
BCAcok = 3.32
DCIN Pin 2 = 16.04 (when fan turns on goes to 16.27
<RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> & 11 are OK
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> & 22 are OK

How do these values look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light, no battery charge
threads.message: I found <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> is not 0 but flashing around will try to replace
